intro: Monosis parishii, commonly known as the Hawaiian monosis, is a flowering plant native to the island of Maui in Hawaii. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
